result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Daytwan Keshon Lacy

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy appeared by video.  Attorney William Anthony Rakestraw Ii appeared by video for Daytwan Keshon Lacy.  Prosecuting attorney Sarah M Dahdouh appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for status conference. Defendant has a pending felony matter in Branch 40 that has been adjourned. Defense counsel requests another status date. Court authorized defendant and defense counsel to appear by zoom at the next court hearing.
Court ordered case adjourned for status conference in Branch 30.
This case will be heard via Zoom. Zoom meeting information provided to parties.
Status conference scheduled for December 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm
Justice Point Pretrial Services Status Report, filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report Received and Filed.

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Sarah Dahdouh appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daytwan Keshon Lacy appeared by video means with Attorney.
Case in court for a status conference. Case has previously been authorized to transfer to Branch 40 for global resolution. Case will still resolve in Branch 40. Case adjourned in Branch 30 to the next court date in Branch 40.  Status conference scheduled for November 1, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Erika Strebel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for status. Defense informs the Court this case may be part of a global resolution in branch 40. 
Court authorizes transfer to Branch 40, if accepted. Case remains calendared in Br 30 for status.  Status conference scheduled for August 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Supervision Report received and filed.  bm

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in court with attorney William Anthony Rakestraw.  Navjot Singh Hira appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
HEARING HELD VIA ZOOM/ LIVE STREAMING THROUGH DACAST. Case in court for status. 
Defense advises the Court the defendant has another pedning matter and asks that this case be transferred to Judge Shelton to allow for a possible global resolution. Defense also advises they are awaiting an offer still. State does not object. 
Court authorizes transfer to Judge Shelton, Branch 40, if accepted. Court orders matter adjourned back to Branch 30 for an additional status.  Status conference scheduled for June 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in court.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daytwan Keshon Lacy appeared by video means.   
Case in court for Pretrial conference.  SPD need more time to appoint counsel.  Case remains calendared in Branch 30.  Status conference scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Justice Point Pretrial Services Report received and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 3.

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in court with attorney Rosemary Cuevas.  Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy in custody.  Jon R Josephsen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Daytwan Keshon Lacy appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Richards, Branch 30.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND QUALIFIES FOR PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION.  
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast: https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/76b667a0-98a1-69d4-e783-9185dc35fcc1  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 19, 2022 at 08:30 am.
COURT ORDERED DEFENDANT REMANDED TO THE COMMISSIONER ON RETURN OF THE ARREST WARRANT.

Defendant Daytwan Keshon Lacy not in court.  Abby Rockendorf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
  Defendant failing to appear, Court ordered an Arrest Warrant to be issued. Upon arrest, defendant is ordered remanded to a commissioner. Court ordered any bail on deposit to be forfeited. The forfeiture order is stayed for 30 days pending notice to the defendant. Court makes a finding that there is no possible victim identified, therefore, restitution is not an issue.
Summons mailed.  Defendant ordered into room 221 Safety Building on 2/28/22 @ 2p
